translation.title: Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

segments.en: 10. Worthy of Offerings Dedicated to the Gods

segments.pli: “Navayime, bhikkhave, puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are nine people worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, and worthy of greeting with joined palms. They are a supreme field of merit for the world.

segments.pli: Arahā, arahattāya paṭipanno, anāgāmī, anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno, sakadāgāmī, sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno, sotāpanno, sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno, gotrabhū—
segments.en: The perfected one, and the one practicing for perfection. The non-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of non-return. The once-returner and the one practicing to realize the fruit of once-return. The stream-enterer and the one practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry. And a member of the spiritual family.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, nava puggalā āhuneyyā … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
segments.en: These nine people are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, and worthy of greeting with joined palms. They are a supreme field of merit for the world.”

suttaplex.blurb: Nine persons are worthy of gifts: the eight noble persons and a member of the spiritual family.
